title: Ignacio Urbina
text:
About Me
I‚Äôm a researcher focused on quantitative methods in social science. I develop open-source tools to make complex methodological concepts more accessible through interactive visualization.
My work spans:

Causal inference and structural equation modeling
Survey methodology and measurement
Teaching technology for quantitative methods


More About Me ‚Üí

title: Teaching
text: Interactive teaching resources for quantitative methods courses. These materials are designed to help students build intuition for statistical concepts through hands-on exploration.

title: Teaching
text:
Interactive Demos


üìä Sampling Distributions
Coming Soon
Visualize how sampling distributions emerge from repeated sampling. Adjust sample size and population parameters to see the central limit theorem in action.

Statistics 101 Interactive Visualization



üéØ Hypothesis Testing
Coming Soon
Interactive demonstration of hypothesis testing concepts. See how p-values, effect sizes, and sample sizes interact.

Inference Interactive Visualization



üìà Regression Intuition

Build intuition for linear regression by manipulating data points and seeing how the regression line responds.

title: Teaching
text:
Resources

Recommended Books


Causal Inference ‚Äî The Effect by Nick Huntington-Klein (free online)
Statistics ‚Äî OpenIntro Statistics (free online)
R Programming ‚Äî R for Data Science by Wickham & Grolemund (free online)
Regression ‚Äî Regression and Other Stories by Gelman, Hill & Vehtari




Online Resources


Seeing Theory ‚Äî Visual introduction to probability and statistics
Distill.pub ‚Äî Clear explanations of machine learning concepts
EGAP Methods Guides ‚Äî Research design guides
Andrew Heiss‚Äôs Course Materials ‚Äî Excellent open course materials

title: Tools
text: A collection of open-source tools I‚Äôve built to support research methodology and teaching. All tools are free to use and hosted on GitHub.

title: Tools
text:
Research Tools



üîÄ CausalFlow

Live


An interactive visual tool for specifying longitudinal causal models and exporting them to lavaan syntax for Structural Equation Modeling (SEM) analysis in R.
Features:

Drag-and-drop interface for building path diagrams
Support for cross-lagged panel models
Automatic lavaan syntax generation
Export to R script


Causal Inference SEM R/lavaan Panel Data Interactive


Launch Tool GitHub




üìà Power Calculator

Coming Soon


Interactive power analysis for common research designs. Calculate sample sizes, visualize power curves, and understand the relationship between effect size, sample size, and statistical power.

Statistics Power Analysis Sample Size Interactive


Coming Soon




üé≤ Bayes Viz

Coming Soon


Visualize Bayesian inference concepts interactively. See how priors, likelihoods, and posteriors interact in real-time.

Bayesian Visualization Teaching Interactive


Coming Soon

title: About
text:
I‚Äôm a researcher focused on quantitative methods in social science. I develop open-source tools to make complex methodological concepts more accessible through interactive visualization.
My research interests include:

Causal inference ‚Äî Methods for identifying causal effects in observational data
Survey methodology ‚Äî Measurement, sampling, and response quality
Computational methods ‚Äî Tools and workflows for reproducible research
Science communication ‚Äî Making research findings accessible to broader audiences

What I Build
I create interactive tools that help researchers and students:

Visualize complex statistical concepts
Specify causal models and research designs
Validate data before analysis
Learn quantitative methods through exploration

All my tools are open-source and freely available.

title: Research
text: Interactive summaries of research projects with embedded visualizations, key findings, and methodology notes. Each brief is designed to communicate core insights while providing access to full details for those who want to dig deeper.

title: Research
text:
What Are Research Briefs?
Research briefs are short, accessible summaries of academic research designed for broader audiences. Unlike full academic papers, briefs:

Focus on insights rather than exhaustive literature review
Use visualization to communicate findings
Include interactivity so readers can explore data
Provide context without requiring specialized knowledge


Example Structure
Each brief follows a consistent format:

TL;DR ‚Äî One-paragraph summary
Key Findings ‚Äî 3-5 main takeaways with supporting visuals
Background ‚Äî Why this question matters
Methods ‚Äî Collapsible section with technical details
Implications ‚Äî What this means for practice/policy
Resources ‚Äî Links to paper, code, data

title: Research
text:
Topics I Cover


Causal Inference ‚Äî Methods for identifying causal effects in observational data
Survey Methodology ‚Äî Measurement, sampling, and response quality
Quantitative Methods ‚Äî Statistical approaches for social science research
Research Technology ‚Äî Tools and workflows for modern research

Code

üî¥ High Priority (Before Launch)

Add profile photo ‚Äî Place profile.jpg in the images/ folder
Add CV ‚Äî Place cv.pdf in the files/ folder
Update personal info in about.qmd:

Bio/introduction
Education history
Email address
LinkedIn URL
Skills & tools

Update contact links in _quarto.yml:

Email address (line: href: mailto:your.email@example.com)
LinkedIn URL

üü° Content to Add

Tools Page (tools/index.qmd)

Add screenshots for CausalFlow and QuizView
Add GitHub repo links for each tool
Add more tools as they‚Äôre ready:

Power Calculator
Bayes Viz
Stats Demos




Research Briefs (research/)

Create first research brief (use research/sample-brief/ as template)
Add interactive Plotly/Altair visualizations
Topics to consider:

Automation attitudes research
AI deliberation findings
Methodology explainers




Teaching Page (teaching/index.qmd)

Add course syllabi
Create interactive demos:

Sampling distributions
Hypothesis testing
Regression intuition

Add lecture slides/materials

üü¢ Optional Enhancements

Custom logo ‚Äî Create and add images/logo.png
Favicon ‚Äî Add site icon
Custom colors ‚Äî Adjust palette in custom.scss if desired
Email subscription ‚Äî Set up newsletter (e.g., Buttondown, Substack)
Analytics ‚Äî Add Google Analytics or Plausible
Comments ‚Äî Add Giscus or Utterances for research briefs
Citation style ‚Äî Download apa.csl and uncomment in _quarto.yml

üöÄ Deployment

Push changes to GitHub
Configure GitHub Pages:

Go to Settings ‚Üí Pages
Set Source to ‚ÄúDeploy from a branch‚Äù
Select Branch: master and Folder: /docs

OR enable GitHub Actions (workflow already created in .github/workflows/publish.yml)
Verify site is live at https://ignaciourbina.github.io

üìù Ongoing Maintenance

Add new tools as they‚Äôre developed
Publish research briefs for new papers
Update CV periodically
Keep teaching materials current

Quick Commands
# Preview site locally
quarto preview

# Build site for production
quarto render

# Check what will be deployed
ls -la docs/
